author: Aubrey De Bliquy
message: @NOXOLO GUMEDE bra? He is only boring if you are looking for entertainment rather then facts. I understand your point. A directive to stop the business of Eskom does seem sinister and does raise fundamental questions. This chairman is impressive. @Syug without even putting it in writing which suggests in itself an incompetence and subservience to authority without accountability. All bucks stop with the voters holding executive accountability ESKOM failure is national economic sucide before covid added the coup de grace @Patrick .Solarnfo Do you agree eskom faiure to be able to supply enough electricity is as fundamental a failure as any country can make. Load shedding is in itself an admission of epic failure. It's not dust buildup on insulators like we got when this started. @Patrick .Solarnfo So you think load shedding is something routine in a functioning country> @Patrick .Solarnfo are you aware of the disruptive costs of load shedding to industry? Sme factories are disasterously disrupted. @Patrick incompetence that is not in Eskom is incompetence de-facto in government. @Patrick .Solarnfo incompetence in business is regulated by bankruptcies. Eskom cannot have a monopoly and plead incompetence thus holding all hostage. How so? @Patrick .Solarnfo My point is that Eskom cannot be allowed to hold a monopoly over a vital national service they are incapable of providing. OK sane people agree Yet the law provides eskom a legislated monopoly on electricity supply thus holding the economy to ransom OK This commission chair is on point. @Pheladi Lamola I think their is a corrupt mindset that cannot comprehend the concept of conflict of interest. I see Eskom failure as a collective failure not to be laid at the door of any one incumbent because this infrastructure requires 20 year foresight and planning LOL @Luyanda A That is called corruption. Don't you understand conflict of interest? @Tebogo Sibilanga On point. üíØ "@Luyanda A Eskom is granted a monopoly service vital to the nation. They provide a service that provides 20 year planning. which could span EFF @Salome Seabi Perhaps that says more about the consensus on corruption than CR who the moment he had the authority as president declared his intention to end corruption as he now is doing. @Mike Clark I think even a private company uses OUR MONEY since we allow corporations to profit off our economy and people. We cant say like FU eskom we are going to buy our electricity from a company that supports EFF. The point is we can see how easily the ANC could use this sutority to fund ANC functions. Yup @Patrick .Solarnfo 100% agree. Any incumbent could use authority over eskom to sponsor party political functions. I never joined the witch hunt against JZ and feel the same about CR. deputy yes i.e.e unlike justice Zondo he should not be in government. Does not understand the basic spirit of service. A company with a monopoly should not need to influence government. It just has to be efficient in service delivery. yes Yes @Salome Seabi As a borne again Dagga user I was watching the Trial of the Plant when SABC and the state and their amicus causae were trying everything to stop scale of harms evidence being lead. "The decision by all our ""HIGH"" court that dagga use in private was a constitutional right was the ""hight"" point of our thriving democracy. LOL" @Thobani Mkananda No offense taken. To each is own. "@Thobani Mkananda A bit off topic @Thobani Mkananda Don't get me started on the COVID19 panic-Demic. A pandemic of stupidity. We have a life threatening virus so like lets close down the country and destroy ppeople income for survival "You get lies ok "Mandela said ""If the ANC does to you what the Apartheid government did to you then you do to the ANC what you did to the Apartheid government.""" OK i get it bro Is telling the truth is piemping? If so one has to choose between piemping and perjury and jail. yes of coure. Some people do not understand the concept of rule of law as opposed to mob rule. Eskom should lose their monopoly the moment the load shed shows they are incapable of meeting the needs of the economy. let us all make electricity and fit two way meters to feed the grid. Eskom then pays us if we use less than we generate. they already have this but it needs to be improved. "SABC won't post the full videoto fill the gaps. Same as when they were complicit in concealing the scale of harms evidence in the ""Trial of the Plant"". They did not want the public to hear the truth." @Thobani Mkananda I think when democracy started there was complicity between the negotiating partners. I can't prove it but it looks like dirty hands dont want to investigate They are all captured by the same mentality we see on display from this witness. They have no clue the part their subservient submissive attitude to government plays in undermining service delivery. This seems to be a pattern of SABC incompetence with live streaming which can be blamed on something spurious. same as the dirty insulators blamed when load shedding started. enca is working fine in the other window.
